Text: Heterophoria:  There can be esophoria, where the eyes tend to cross inward in the absence of fusion; exophoria, in which they diverge; or hyperphoria, in which one eye points up or down relative to the other.

Text: Heterophoria:  The opposite of heterophoria, where the eyes are straight when relaxed and not fusing, is called orthophoria.
